DOC.brief_summary: Comparison of the effects of 4 ventilators dedicated to NIV (2 home ventilators and 2 ventilators designed for NIV) on patient-ventilator synchrony and comfort in patients admitted in the intensive care unit for respiratory failure and treated with NIV.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Synchrony Between 4 NIV Ventilators
DOC.criteria: respiratory failure Severe hypoxemia requiring an FiO2 > 0.6 Hemodynamic instability : defined as a variation of > 20% in mean arterial pressure (MAP) and heart rate (HR) during the previous 2 hours; the need for high doses of catecholamines (namely > 0.5 mcg/kg/min) and/or the need of major volume resuscitation (more than 2 liters of fluids in 2 hours) Impaired consciousness or absence of patient cooperation; Facial or laryngeal lesions contraindicating the use of NIV; Poor short term prognosis. Age < 18 years old
